title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic novel that explores racial injustice in a small Southern town.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the decadence and excess of the Roaring Twenties.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian future society.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A novel of manners set in 19th-century England.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: A novel that tells the story of the Buendia family over the course of a century.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A novel that explores the legacy of slavery in America.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about a teenage boy's experiences in New York City.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel that follows a hobbit named Frodo on a quest to destroy a powerful ring.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about a young man who sells his soul for eternal youth and beauty.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who sets out on a quest.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A novel that follows a family of migrant workers during the Great Depression.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A novel about a scientist who creates a monster that becomes uncontrollable.
